alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Forsyth, Gwinnett, southwestern Hall and eastern Fulton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 638 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Sugar Hill, or 8 miles southeast of Cumming, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceville, Peachtree Corners, Johns Creek, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Snellville, Suwanee, Buford, Lilburn, Norcross, Berkeley Lake, Rest Haven, Tucker, Mountain Park, Buford Dam-Lake Lanier Parks, Mechanicsville, Lake Lanier Islands, and Hog Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
